utilities
Class Position

java.lang.Object
  utilities.Point
      utilities.Position

public class Position
extends Point

Using the Point class as a base, Position adds an angle theta.

addDistanceToPosition

public Point addDistanceToPosition(double distance)
This method assumes the robot is at this position presently. It adds a distance to this position, generating a new Point object. This is useful when the robot needs to travel somewhere in a straight line ahead of it. Formula used for newX position is x + deltaX where deltaX is distance * cos(theta). A Point object is returned due to logical reasons (the angle the robot ends up at its destination is not necessarily the same as the angle it started with).

Parameters:
distance - A distance the robot should travel forward
Returns:
A point with the destination coordinates.

addDisAndAngleToPosition

public Point addDisAndAngleToPosition(double distance,
                                      double angle)
This method assumes the robot is at this position presently. It adds a distance to this position, generating a new Point object. It also adds the input angle to that position. This method is useful when the robot needs to travel somewhere relative to its current position. Formula used for newX position is x + deltaX where deltaX is distance * cos(theta). Theta in this case is the sum of its current angle and the input angle A Point object is returned due to logical reasons (the angle the robot ends up at its destination is not necessarily the same as the angle it started with).

Parameters:
distance - A distance the robot should travel
angle - An angle the robot wants to turn by (relative to its current angle).
Returns:
A point with the destination coordinates.

goToDistanceAndAngle

public Point goToDistanceAndAngle(double distance,
                                  double angle)
This method assumes the robot is at this position presently. It adds a distance to this position, generating a new Point object. It also adds the input angle to that position. This method is useful when the robot needs to travel somewhere relative to its current position. Formula used for newX position is x + deltaX where deltaX is distance * cos(theta). Theta in this case is the input angle. A Point object is returned due to logical reasons (the angle the robot ends up at its destination is not necessarily the same as the angle it started with).

Parameters:
distance - A distance the robot should travel
angle - An angle the robot wants to turn to (exactly).
Returns:
A point with the destination coordinates.
